meanings.definition: Capable of being endured or tolerated.
meanings.sent1: The long wait was sufferable for the patient child.
meanings.sent2: The mild headache was sufferable, so she continued with her work.
meanings.sent3: The boring movie was sufferable, but it made him doze off.
meanings.sent4: The scorching heat was barely sufferable under the blazing sun.
meanings.sent5: The itchy sweater was sufferable, but she couldn't wait to take it off.

meanings.definition: Capable of being allowed or permitted.
meanings.sent1: The small pets were sufferable in the apartment.
meanings.sent2: The flexible schedule was sufferable for the busy student.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was sufferable during playtime.
meanings.sent4: The extra time was barely sufferable for the strict teacher.
meanings.sent5: The noise level was sufferable in the bustling city.
